example_utterances: Oh no! I just spilled my coffee on my new white shirt!
Yes, I have. I've been more careful and double-checking my work.
Boss, I wanted to thank you for listening to me the other day. It wasn't easy for me to express how I really feel, but I'm glad I did.

Well, I've been feeling more confident lately, especially after making that mistake a few months ago. I realized that it's okay to make mistakes and ask for help when I need it. And when I told you how I felt, it was like a weight was lifted off my shoulders.

Yes, exactly. And I wanted to also express how important you are to me as my boss and mentor. I appreciate all the guidance and support you've given me, and I don't want it to ever seem like I take that for granted.
Boss, I'm sorry but I made another mistake. I spilled coffee on my new white shirt. I feel really embarrassed especially since you're staring at me.
Yes, it was really helpful. I felt heard and understood by you which made me feel more valued as an employee.
I was just thinking about how I always try to be careful and make the right decisions before acting. I think it's important to approach things with a clear mind and not rush into anything.
Boss, I just finished repairing a roof for a client and charged them $50 for the job.
Yes, they were very happy with it. I made sure to double check everything before I left to make sure that the repair was secure.
